statements.statement: Owning a car means thinking about costs like maintenance, insurance, parking and repair which become too much.
There are so many sharing car, bike and scooter options that I do not feel like I will need to own any vehicle.
It is difficult to get groceries on a bike or walking so I would prefer a car.
I feel guilty taking a mode of transport that is not environmentally friendly but my time and money are more important.
Its easier to use public transport since I can find all the timings, the fastest and best possible route on my phone.
I like travelling by bike because its faster, cheaper and gives a good start to the day.
If I had more money I would travel more. Now I try to travel less because it's expensive to travel.
I've been online shopping a lot recently. This takes away the need for me to travel a lot.
The infrastructure to walk/bike/use Public transport is so good. I don’t think you ever need to use a car.
Public transport is expensive. It would be cheaper for me per ride if I had a car.
I think its better using shared mobility than owning a vehicle as it is better for the environment.
I only use a taxi when I can share the costs with someone.
Owning a car is nice since you wouldn’t have to worry about getting a seat.
Owning a car can make it easier to travel.
I like the privacy a car gives when travelling.
It is so difficult finding parking in cities which is why I would prefer using a taxi when I need a car.
I don’t think we need a car anymore but my parents and other older members of my family still think its needed.
The environmental impact of a mode does matter, but I prefer my comfort.
I like using shared bikes and scooters. They're fast, cheap and I don’t worry about parking.
The weather is so unpredictable, its easier to travel if I own a car.
Having a car can give an individual a sense of freedom.
It is easy for me to use shared mobility. I can access it with my phone at any time and don’t need to worry about anything.
Currently it is difficult for me to own a car/ regularly use a car since I cannot afford it.
Even though the public transportation in the Netherlands is good. I think you still need a car sometimes.
Shared mobility is expensive so I prefer using public transport or just walking/biking.
I think travelling via car since it gives a sense of safety.
Using public transport is nice because you know exactly how much you will spend per ride. That is more difficult if you have a car.
Sometimes public transportation is unreliable because either the road is closed to there is some work in progress on a railway line.
Owning a car is too much of a hassle, especially if I'm living in a city. I rather spend that money elsewhere.
I don’t want to use a car/ try to use the car less due to environmental reasons.
Using a car is more comfortable since you can stop anywhere you like and go on your own time.
I don’t like using shared cars since you have to travel with someone you do not know.
My need to travel has reduced in recent times since I can do everything online.
If I were living away from a city I would prefer having a car for my commute.
When I need to travel using public transport I have to plan a lot. I do not like doing that planning.
If there were more shared mobility options easily available I do not think I would need a car.
The public transportation is so efficient that I do not feel the need to use a car.
Public transportation takes too long and I need to make multiple changes. So I would like using a car.
I don’t want to use a car but I wouldn’t mind using once if its electric.
I think its nice to live somewhere where all my needs are met at a walkable distance. This removes the need of having a car.
